headline: Southern Company Q4: Utility Growth Boosts Revenue, But Rising Costs Weigh on Profit
summary: Southern Company (NYSE:SO) shares are trading lower on Thursday after the company reported fourth-quarter operating revenue growth of 4.9% year over year to $6.34 billion, beating the consensus of $5.88 billion. Operating revenues by segment: Alabama Power $1.751 billion (+7.4% Y/Y), Georgia Power $2.586 billion (+11.8% Y/Y), Mississippi Power $345 million (+2.4% Y/Y), Southern Power $417 million (-17.1% Y/Y) and Southern Company Gas $1.236 billion (-3.8% Y/Y). Kilowatt-Hour Sales rose by 2.7%,

headline: Southern Co. (SO) Lags Q4 Earnings Estimates
summary: Southern Co. (SO) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of -1.96% and 1.96%, respectively, for the quarter ended December 2024. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Southern Co.: Q4 Earnings Snapshot
summary: The results missed Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of six analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for earnings of 51 cents per share. The power company posted revenue of $6.34 billion in the period, topping Street forecasts.

raw.headline: Southern Co.: Q4 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Southern Company reports fourth-quarter and full-year 2024 earnings
summary: Southern Company today reported fourth-quarter earnings of $534 million, or 49 cents per share, in 2024 compared with earnings of $855 million, or 78 cents per share, in the fourth quarter of 2023. Southern Company also reported full-year 2024 earnings of $4.4 billion, or $4.02 per share, compared with $4.0 billion, or $3.64 per share, in 2023.
